shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Introduction - The “Synopsis of Classes” (fols. 2ra-2vb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew: 68 titles (3ra-vb) (misplaced) - Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus (fols. 4r-5r) - Canon tables (fols. 5v-8v) - The 72 disciples (fol. 184ra-rb) (misplaced) II) Gospel of Matthew (fols.14ra-62rb) - Bǝsratä Matewos “Gospel of Matthew” (fols. 14ra-62rb) III) Gospel of Mark (fols. 64ra-92va) - Bǝsratä Marqos “Gospel of Mark” (fols. 64ra-92va) IV) Gospel of Luke (fols. 92vb-144ra) - List of “tituli” for the Gospel of Luke: 83 titles (fols. 92vb-93vb) - Bǝsratä Luqas “Gospel of Luke” (fols. 95ra-144ra) V) Gospel of John (fols. 144rb-183va) - List of the “tituli” of the Gospel of John: 19 titles (fol. 144rb) - Bǝsratä Yoḥannǝs “Gospel of John” (fols. 146ra-183va) - Postscript (fol. 183va-183vb)
Additiones 1-4.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered by reddish-brown tooled leather; textile (blue) inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

squires.squire: I(3, s.l.: 1, stub after 3; 2, stub after 1; 3, stub after 2/fols. 1r-3v) – II(6/fols. 4r-9v) – III(3; s.l.: 2, stub after 1/fols. 10r-12v) – IV(8/fols. 13r-20v) – V(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 21r-28v) – VI(8/fols. 29r-36v) – VII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 37r-44v) – VIII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 45r-52v) – IX(6/fols. 53r-58v) – X(5; s.l.: 4, stub after 1/fols. 59r-63v) – XI(8/fols. 64r-71v) – XII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 72r-79v) – XIII(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fols. 80r-86v) – XIV(8/fols. 87r-94v) – XV(8/fols. 95r-102v) – XVI(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 103r-110v) – XVII(8/fols. 111r-118v) – XVIII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 119r-126v) – XIX(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 127r-134v) – XX(6/fols. 135r-141v) – XXI(5; s.l.: 4, stub after 1/fols. 142r-145v) – XXII(8/fols. 146r-153v) – XXIII(8/fols. 154r-161v) – XXIV(8/fols. 162r-169v) – XXV(8/fols. 170r-177v) – XXVI(6/fols. 178r-183v) – XXVII(1/fol. 184)

taunit.mr-info: All data are for the second page of the first Gospel, recto side (fol. 14r).
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written below the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; incipits and headings of the texts; numbers and titles of the chapters in the upper margins of the fols.; elements of the punctuation signs and numbers; in the incipit page of each Gospel, a few lines are rubricated (in groups of two lines, alternating with black lines); crux ansata.

additional.cont: Fol. 11v (outer margin): Excerpt from “Ordinary of the Mass” (MQ, Śǝrˁatä qǝddase, §§ 160-171) followed by a directive for the ministers.
Fol. 63ra: Note concerning tributes and revenues for the church or Qärsäbär.
additional.tran: The note is written in red ink; mentioning the name of Queen Zäwditu (r. 1916-30).

additional.det: The note is poorly readable, with two signatures (finger prints) at the bottom.

additional.cont: Fol. 94r-b: Yä-Qärsäbär ḥəgg, Note concerning customary law of Qärsäbär.
additional.tran: The note is dated to 1929 year of mercy.

extras.extra: - The title is inserted above, in the decorative band, in the incipit page of each Gospel. - A short note concerning the death of an individual has been written in a more recent hand, in the bottom margin of fol. 13r: ʾǝm-ḥamusu lä-Näḥase ʾaʿräfä Kǝflä ʾIyäsus. - Tämälläs-sign indicating the place where the omission, written in the upper margin, belongs: fol. 50v. - An extensive note has been washed out: fol. 144v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Readings are indicated by the names of the feasts written in the upper margin of some fols. - Readings for the Holy Week are indicated by the hours: fols. 51r-60v. - Coloured threads are inserted in the upper edges of some fols.

miniature.info: Fol. 11r: Preparation of the body of Jesus by Joseph of Arimathea and Nicodemus.
Fol. 11v: Apparition of Jesus to Mary, mother of James, and to Mary of Magdala.

frames.frame: Frontispiece decorations: elaborate coloured ornamental bands. Fol. 14ra (incipit page of Matthew): elaborate coloured (blue, green, yellow, red) ornamental frame: two horizontal bands; interlaces with the title (Wängel zä-Matewos); one central and two short lateral extensions. Fol. 64ra (incipit page of Mark): elaborate coloured (blue, green, yellow, red) ornamental frame: two horizontal bands; interlaces with the title (Wängel zä-Marqos); one central and two short lateral extensions. Fol. 95ra (incipit page of Luke): elaborate coloured (blue, green, yellow, red) ornamental frame: two horizontal bands; interlaces with the title (Wängel zä-Luqas). Central and lateral extensions are very short. Fol. 146r (incipit page of John) elaborate coloured (blue, green, yellow, red) ornamental frame; interlaces with the title (Wängel zä-Yoḥannǝs) written below; one central and two short lateral extensions (longer than on fol. 95r).
